Docs.summary: Reads a tar archive from a stream.

Docs.param: to dispose the when this instance is disposed; to leave the stream open.
Docs.summary: Initializes a instance that can read tar entries from the specified stream, and can optionally leave the stream open upon disposal of this instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Dispose ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed
Public Sub Dispose ()
abstract member Dispose : unit -> unit override this.Dispose : unit -> unit
public: virtual void Dispose();

Docs.summary: Disposes the current instance, and disposes the streams of all the entries that were read from the archive if the leaveOpen argument was set to in the constructor.
Docs.remarks: The property of any entry can be replaced with a new stream. If the user decides to replace it on a instance that was obtained using a , the underlying stream gets disposed immediately, freeing the of origin from the responsibility of having to dispose it.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask DisposeAsync ();

Public Function DisposeAsync () As ValueTask
abstract member DisposeAsync : unit -> System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask override this.DisposeAsync : unit -> System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask
public: virtual System::Threading::Tasks::ValueTask DisposeAsync();

Docs.summary: Asynchronously disposes the current instance, and closes the streams of all the entries that were read from the archive if the leaveOpen argument was set to in the constructor.
Docs.returns: A value task that represents the asynchronous dispose operation.
Docs.remarks:
The property of any entry can be replaced with a new stream. If the user decides to replace it on a instance that was obtained using a , the underlying stream gets disposed immediately, freeing the of origin from the responsibility of having to dispose it.
This method stores in the task it returns all non-usage exceptions that the method's synchronous counterpart can throw. If an exception is stored into the returned task, that exception will be thrown when the task is awaited. Usage exceptions, such as , are still thrown synchronously. For the stored exceptions, see the exceptions thrown by .

Public Function GetNextEntry (Optional copyData As Boolean = false) As TarEntry
member this.GetNextEntry : bool -> System.Formats.Tar.TarEntry

param.name: copyData
param.para: to copy the data of the entry into a new . This is helpful when the underlying archive stream is unseekable, and the data needs to be accessed later.
if the data should not be copied into a new stream. If the underlying stream is unseekable, the user has the responsibility of reading and processing the immediately after calling this method.

Docs.summary: Retrieves the next entry from the archive stream.
Docs.returns: A instance if a valid entry was found, or if the end of the archive has been reached.
Docs.exception:
The entry's data is malformed.
-or-
The archive contains entries in different formats.
-or-
More than one global extended attributes entry was found in the current archive.
-or-
Two or more extended attributes entries were found consecutively in the current archive.

param.name: copyData
param.para: to copy the data of the entry into a new . This is helpful when the underlying archive stream does not support seeking, and the data needs to be accessed later.

if the data should not be copied into a new stream. If the underlying stream does not support seeking, the user has the responsibility of reading and processing the immediately after calling this method.

Docs.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
Docs.summary: Asynchronously retrieves the next entry from the archive stream.
Docs.returns: A value task containing a instance if a valid entry was found, or if the end of the archive has been reached.
Docs.remarks: This method stores in the task it returns all non-usage exceptions that the method's synchronous counterpart can throw. If an exception is stored into the returned task, that exception will be thrown when the task is awaited. Usage exceptions, such as , are still thrown synchronously. For the stored exceptions, see the exceptions thrown by .
Docs.exception:
The archive is malformed.
-or-
The archive contains entries in different formats.
-or-
More than one Global Extended Attributes Entry was found in the current archive.
-or-
Two or more Extended Attributes entries were found consecutively in the current archive.
The cancellation token was canceled. This exception is stored into the returned task.
